channel.title: Ari Decter-Frain
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

item.title: How I got here
item.description: University of Winnipeg I completed my undergraduate degree in Psychology at the University of Winnipeg. While studying I worked in Dr. Jeremy Frimer’s Moral Psychology lab. We used experiments and natural language processing to study: The psychological differences between liberals and conservatives. The determinants of public approval of governing bodies, specifically US Congress. How leaders emerge and interact with social movements. I also studied philosophy. I discovered the liberal views of John Stuart Mill, John Rawls and Amartya Sen, which continue to guide my beliefs about morality and politics today.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I’m a PhD student in Cornell’s Policy Analysis and Management program. Through policy, governments set the rules of the game that all firms and workers play. I want to change the rules so that the game gives fairer rewards and everyone has a more equal chance at success. Why do people flock to major cities despite ever-rising costs of living? Why is competition declining across industries? How did elite education become a necessary and sufficient condition for economic success?
